target_assessment.notes: [The model did not find the issue on the target_assessment.]

other_findings.model_claim: The _handleETHTransfer function is vulnerable to reentrancy attacks because it calls an external contract (msg.sender) before updating the state. An attacker can exploit this by reentering the function and draining the contract's funds.
other_findings.reasoning: [It does not transfer funds, so there is no meaningful reentrancy vector here.]

other_findings.model_claim: The add_liquidity function is vulnerable to integer overflows when calculating the LP tokens to mint. An attacker can exploit this by providing large input values
other_findings.reasoning: [Since Solidity 0.8, arithmetic operations (+, *, etc.) are checked by default and will revert on overflow/underflow. Therefore, integer overflow is not possible here.]
